results.title: Directing a play
results.creator_credit: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: Rehearsals of Louise Dale Spoor’s adaptation of Mark Twain’s “Tom Sawyer” are used to illustrate the work of the director in the performance of a stage play. Shows the first reading of the play by cast and director followed by a discussion of the play, its actions and characters; preliminary work on the stage floor, rehearsals without props; recording of action times and stage movements; the first dress rehearsal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds and International Film Bureau

results.title: Directing a film: Ionesco's 'The New tenant'
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: To better acquaint students with the role of the director in motion picture production, this film takes them behind the scenes both before and during the filming of Eugene Ionesco’s play “The New Tenant”. Scenes from the early stages of planning and preparation are intercut with scenes from the completed film version of the play to enable students to better understand how the director’s initial thoughts and ideas are realized.

results.title: Diplomacy
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The history of the diplomat’s functions and skills. The commentary includes quotations from figures as contrasted as Demosthenes, Machiavelli, and President Kennedy. Shows how the modern career diplomat exercises techniques developed over centuries, but today is supported by the resources of modern technology. He must have qualities of patience, integrity and a strong sense of national purpose. Narrated by Alastair Duncan.

results.title: Dinosaurs: the age of the terrible lizard
results.brief_description: An animated film which presents an overview of the dinosaur age, showing the major types of dinasaurs and some of their behavioural characteristics. Gives evidence of evolutionary development and indicates a possible reason for their becoming extinct. Edited version of film “Dinozaury”.

results.title: Dinosaur junction series
results.brief_description: This video contains three short episodes of ‘Dinosaur Junction’ which uses animated dinosaurs to illustrate in a fun way how children can learn to cope with problems they face such as peer pressure and fighting. ‘Doin’ it you way’ looks at decision making and peer pressure; ‘The fight’ looks at controlling your temper and dealing with anger; ‘What’s in a name’ looks at self esteem and fitting in. Suitable for Primary level students.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Will Vinton and Will Vinton Productions
results.brief_description: Clay animated figures and simple chalk line drawings are transformed into awe-inspiring prehistoric animals in this interpretation of our earth as it existed long before man. A fastpaced motivating introduction to dinosaurs and their prehistoric world, suitable for children of all ages.

results.title: Dinner at the Homesick Restaurant [a discussion]
results.creator_credit: David Zweck, Daryl Wayland, Country Education Project and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: Jocelyn Terry leads a discussion with Val Kent of Huntingdale Technical School and Dr. Alan Diknot of Monash University to provide some explanations of the puzzling aspects of Anne Tyler’s novel. The program discusses why the novel opens with Pearl’s death; our sympathy for Pearl and for Beck; the effect of their upbringing on the children; and the role of the subsidiary characters.

results.title: Dime
results.creator_credit: Larry Klingman and Little Red Filmhouse
results.brief_description: Follows the circulation of a dime from the mint through many changes of hands. Explores the various functions of money from its use as a means of exchange for goods and services to coin collecting. Concludes as a young boy tries to retrieve the coin from a storm drain and put it back into circulation.
